poem:
A Seaside Fragment

Beneath the sun's indifference,
the sea, complicit,
laps at packages of flesh,
life dismembered, justice
chopping sentences 
for children to discover
in skin-tight wrappings.
What murders us, 
is not the act alone,
but the silent scream 
of limbs parted,
mourning unity
on a careless shore.
